exercises.question:
TEXT: My name is Marco. I live in a small house. Every morning, I wake up at 7:00. I drink coffee and eat bread. Then, I go to work by bus. I am a teacher. I love my students because they are very kind. In the evening, I cook dinner and watch TV. I go to bed at 10:00. I am happy.

Question: Marco lives in a ___ house.
exercises.hint: Check the second sentence of the story.
exercises.example_sentence: I live in a small house in the city.

exercises.question: What time does Marco wake up?
exercises.hint: He does this 'every morning'.
exercises.example_sentence: I wake up at 7:00 to go to school.

exercises.question: Match the verbs from the text with their objects.
exercises.hint: The text says he drinks coffee and eats bread.
exercises.example_sentence: I cook dinner for my family.

exercises.question: Reorder the words to describe how Marco goes to work.
exercises.answer: He goes to work by bus
exercises.hint: Look for the sentence after 'bread'.
exercises.example_sentence: She goes to work by car.

exercises.question: Read the following sentence aloud: 'I love my students because they are very kind.'
exercises.example_sentence: My teacher is very kind.
exercises.hint: Focus on 'Students' (STOO-dents).

exercises.question: Marco is a ___, and he works with students.
exercises.hint: This is his job.
exercises.example_sentence: The teacher is in the classroom.

exercises.question: Why does Marco love his students?
exercises.hint: Check the sentence about his students.
exercises.example_sentence: I love my cat because he is cute.

exercises.question: Match the times with the activities.
exercises.hint: The text follows a timeline from morning to night.
exercises.example_sentence: I go to bed early.

exercises.question: Reorder the words to describe Marco's feelings.
exercises.answer: I am happy with my life
exercises.hint: This is the final sentence of the text.
exercises.example_sentence: I am happy today.

exercises.question: In the ___ Marco watches TV.
exercises.hint: He does this before going to bed.
exercises.example_sentence: I watch movies in the evening.

exercises.question: How does Marco go to work?
exercises.hint: It is a public vehicle.
exercises.example_sentence: He takes the bus at 8:00.

exercises.question: Match the adjectives with the nouns they describe.
exercises.hint: Look at how the text describes people and things.
exercises.example_sentence: Marco is a happy man.

exercises.question: Marco goes to ___ at 10:00.
exercises.hint: He does this when he is tired at night.
exercises.example_sentence: I go to bed at night.

exercises.question: Reorder the words to show Marco's name.
exercises.hint: This is the first sentence.
exercises.example_sentence: My name is John.

exercises.question: Read aloud: 'Every morning, I wake up at 7:00.'
exercises.example_sentence: Every morning I drink tea.
exercises.hint: Focus on 'Morning' (MOR-ning).

exercises.question: Marco eats ___ for breakfast.
exercises.hint: He eats this with his coffee.
exercises.example_sentence: I like fresh bread.

exercises.question: What is the text about?
exercises.hint: The text describes his routine.
exercises.example_sentence: Tell me about your day.

exercises.question: Match the opposites based on common knowledge (A1).
exercises.hint: These words are used in the text.
exercises.example_sentence: The house is big, not small.

exercises.question: Reorder the words to show what Marco drinks.
exercises.answer: He drinks a cup of coffee
exercises.hint: He does this at 7:00.
exercises.example_sentence: I want a cup of water.

exercises.question: Marco says: 'I love my ___ because they are very kind.'
exercises.hint: He is a teacher, so he works with them.
exercises.example_sentence: The students are in the library.
